main event: A bright light was reported moving in a circular course 70,000 feet above Chicago, Illinois on April 22, 1952, heading north for 5 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright light moving in a circular course at high altitude.
The object was observed for 5 minutes before it was concluded to likely be a balloon.
There were multiple sightings of similar bright lights moving in the skies around Chicago, Cleveland, and Des Moines during late April 1952.
The objects were described as having high speeds, sudden stops, and 90-degree turns, as well as being silent or making a faint humming noise.
The reliability of the witnesses was noted to include military, commercial, and private pilots, as well as scientists and engineers.
